intro: Tetratome tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly tetratome, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties. Tetratome tomentosa typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its unique appearance and fragrance make it a distinctive addition to gardens and natural habitats.
